description: Borrowed from Medieval Latin intoxicātus, past participle of intoxicō, from Latin toxicō < toxicus, from Ancient Greek τοξικόν (toxikón).

adjectives.description: intoxicate (comparative more intoxicate, superlative most intoxicate)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Overexcited, as with joy or grief.

verbs.description: intoxicate (third-person singular simple present intoxicates, present participle intoxicating, simple past and past participle intoxicated)

entries.meaning: To stupefy by doping with chemical substances such as alcohol.
To excite to enthusiasm or madness.
